info.name: Eclypse 1.0
info.description:
http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/publicAPI

Rest API

The REST APIs provides programmatic access to read and write BACnet data, configure your Eclypse system, manage the users and more. The REST API identifies Eclypse applications and users using BASIC authentication; responses are available in JSON and Xml.

request.description:
http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1036/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/mstp-ports

This resource lists all BACnet MS/TP ports.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1037/POST

POST /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/mstp-ports/{id}

This resource allows you to view and to set the MS/TP network configuration parameters.

{
  "enabled": false,
  "networkNumber": 6,
  "baudRate": 38400,
  "macAddress": 0,
  "maxMaster": 127,
  "maxInfoFrame": 3
}

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1042/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/ip-ports/{id}/foreign-devices

Some BACnet/IP devices also support a feature called Foreign Device Registration (FDR). FDR allows a BACnet/IP device to send broadcast messages to a device with BBMD enabled. The BBMD-enabled device will then forward these broadcast messages to all other BBMDs and onto all other FDR devices. If a subnet has only FDR supported devices then it does not need a local BBMD. These devices can register directly with a BBMD on another subnetwork.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1040/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/ip-ports/{id}/bbmd-list

This resource lists all the BBMD-enabled controllers located on other subnetworks.

BACnet/IP devices send broadcast discovery messages such as “Who-Is” as a means to discover other BACnet devices on the network. However, when there are two or more BACnet/IP subnetworks, broadcast messages do not pass through network routers that separate these subnetworks.
BBMD allows broadcast message to pass through a router: on each subnet, a single device has BBMD enabled. Each BBMD device ensures BACnet/IP connectivity between subnets by forwarding broadcast messages found on its subnetwork to each other, and then onto the local subnetwork as a broadcast message.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1040/POST

POST /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/ip-ports/{id}/bbmd-list

This resource lists all the BBMD-enabled controllers located on other subnetworks.

BACnet/IP devices send broadcast discovery messages such as “Who-Is” as a means to discover other BACnet devices on the network. However, when there are two or more BACnet/IP subnetworks, broadcast messages do not pass through network routers that separate these subnetworks.
BBMD allows broadcast message to pass through a router: on each subnet, a single device has BBMD enabled. Each BBMD device ensures BACnet/IP connectivity between subnets by forwarding broadcast messages found on its subnetwork to each other, and then onto the local subnetwork as a broadcast message.

All properties are required.

If the request is successful, the server responds with an Http Code 201 Created.


{
  "ip": "1.1.1.1",
  "port": 47807,
  "mask": "255.255.252.0"
}

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1041/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/ip-ports/{id}/bbmd-list/{bbmdId}

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1041/DELETE

DELETE /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/ip-ports/{id}/bbmd-list/{bbmdId}

This is the details of a specific BBMD.

No body is needed.
http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1038/GET#

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1075/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/router-entries

This resource list all the value include in the routing table.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1035/GET

This resource allows you to enable the routing of BACnet packets between BACnet MS/TP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Controller’s RS-485 port and other IP-connected controllers (for example, BACnet/IP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Controller’s Ethernet Switch ports or controllers connected through Wi-Fi). For example, routing must be enabled for EC-NetAX to discover the BACnet MS/TP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Connected System Controller’s RS-485 port.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1035/POST

This resource allows you to enable the routing of BACnet packets between BACnet MS/TP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Controller’s RS-485 port and other IP-connected controllers (for example, BACnet/IP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Controller’s Ethernet Switch ports or controllers connected through Wi-Fi). For example, routing must be enabled for EC-NetAX to discover the BACnet MS/TP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Connected System Controller’s RS-485 port.
http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1034/GET

Read multiple points in one request. This reduces
the amount of network traffic required to transmit data.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1024/POST

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1023/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/local/objects

These objects represent physical inputs, outputs, and values used by and coming from software processes.

This resource lists all of the current objects on the device.

GET /protocols/bacnet/local

Resource URL: https://{deviceIP}/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local

Documentation: http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1022/GET

POST /protocols/bacnet/local/management/{reinitializable}

This resource is used to perform multiple actions.

There is no body to add.

Resource URL: https://{deviceIP}/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/management/{reinitializable}

Documentation: http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1033/POST



reinitializable

Different actions can be taken:

    cold-start: reboot the device
    warm-start: reboot the system application
    start-backup: start a backup
    end-backup: end the backup
    start-restore: start a restore
    end-restore: end a restore
    abort-restore: abort the restore

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1032/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/local/event-notifications

This resource lists all event notifications for all BACnet objects.

The response is only available in Application/Xml

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1080/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/local/event-notifications/{uuid}

This resource print one specific event notification.

The response is only available in Application/Xml

This resource is the root of all BACnet objects and properties.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1021/GET

This resource is the root of all BACnet objects and properties.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1021/GET

This resource is the extensions management root. Below, you can access the extensions or the discovery action.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/1010/GET

This resource shows two elements; first you will find the status of the extension discovery that can be "running" or "idle" and second the controller address used to start the extentions discovery.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/1014/GET

This controller is used to start the extensions discovery; you can see the discovery status on the /info/extension-management/discovery resource.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/1015/POST

This resource lists all the extensions that have been discovered. It is possible that you have some extensions plugged in but are unable to view them. This could be because you need to start a discovery operation first.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/1011/GET

This resource is the root of the network section.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/1016/GET

This resource lists all network adapters.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/1017/GET

This resource is used to show all the network adapter’s details. You must replace the "adaptersName" in the URL with the actual network adapter’s name.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/1018/GET

This resource is used to show all the network adapter’s details. You must replace the "adaptersName" in the URL with the actual network adapter’s name.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/1018/GET

This resource is used to show all the network adapter’s details. You must replace the "adaptersName" in the URL with the actual network adapter’s name.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/1018/GET

This lists the main device object’s BACnet values.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/1009/GET

This resource returns a summary of the most important device information.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/7/GET

This resource returns all the basic information about the REST API. You can find 5 low resources: BACnet, device, extensions, network, supported services.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/6/GET

This resource lists all the services supported by the device.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/info/resources/1019/GET

item.name: Network

request.description:
This resource shows the network adapters available on the device.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/network/resources/1053/GET

This resource shows the network adapters available on the device.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/network/resources/1053/GET

item.description: This is where wired and wireless network configuration parameters are set.

header.description:
If this parameter is not in the request, the Application/Json will be chosen by default.
There are multiple possible values (according the resource):

*     Application/Json
*     Application/Xml
*     Application/Octet-stream
*     Text/Plain

The first two are used most often used.

 

* Optional: **Yes**
* Located in : **Header**
* Example values : **accept:application/json**

query.description:
Used when you are operating a browser without access to the header parameter. This allows you to choose which encoding you want to use for the response:
* json
* xml
* text
* bin

All these resources can be used according what the resource allows.

 

* Optional: **Yes**
* Located in: **Query**
* Example Values: **encode=json**

request.description: *** # GET /files *** ## Official Documentation: [Rest API GET /files](http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/files/resources/9/GET) This resource works like an explorer. You can go through the files and folders in the device. You can read, add, or remove a file/folder. With this resource, the encode parameters (see below) are very useful when navigating with a browser. * If you want to see the body of a file, you need to set the encode value to **text**. This will work only for a human-readable file. * If you want to download the file, set the encode value to **bin**. The file will be downloaded in the browser. * If you want to download the entire folder, set the encode value to **zip**. A zip file will be downloaded in the browser. * If you use **json** or **XML** you will get the details about the file or folder where you are located in. For more details on these last two points, please refer to the examples below. The examples below show the two possible representations (file and folder). To access this resource with something other than the browser, use the header **accept** and not the **encode** query parameter. ## Resource URL: https://{deviceIP}/api/rest/v1/files   ## Resource Information * Support Query Parameter? YES * Requires Authentication? YES   ## Object(S) Representation ### Object Name: File | Property Name | Type| Description| Method| | -------- | -------- | -------- | -------- | | **FileName** | String | This is the name of the file. | GET | | **Modified** | String | This is the date and time of the last file update. | GET | | **Size** | Integer | This is the file size. | GET |   ### Object Name: FileFolder | Property Name | Type| Description| Method| | -------- | -------- | -------- | -------- | | **DirectoryName** | String | This is the name of the folder. | GET | | **NbFilesDir** | Integer | This is the number of elements inside this folder (files and folders). | GET | | **FileFolders** | Array | This contains a large number of FIleFolders. This represents all the folders that exists in this current folder. | GET | | **Files** | Array | This contains a variety of files that represents all the files existing inside this current folder. | GET |   ## Example Body Response #### Application/JSON ##### URL Example https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/files/licenses/license.xml ```json { "fileName": "license.xml", "size": 2233, "modified": "04/19/2016 12:11:29" } ```   #### Application/JSON ##### URL Example https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/files/bacnet/configuration/file ```json { "files": [ { "path": { "href": "/api/rest/v1/files/bacnet/configuration/file/file1.xml", "name": "file1.xml" }, "modified": "04/07/2020 11:12:34", "size": "545" }, { "path": { "href": "/api/rest/v1/files/bacnet/configuration/file/file1.zip", "name": "file1.zip" }, "modified": "04/07/2020 11:12:34", "size": "0" } ], "directoryName": "file", "fileFolders": [], "nbFilesDir": 2 } ```   #### Application/XML ##### URL Example https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/files/licenses/license.xml ```xml license.xml 04/19/2016 12:11:29 2233 ```   #### Application/XML ##### URL Example https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/files/bacnet/configuration/file ##### Example Result ```xml file 2 /api/rest/v1/files/bacnet/configuration/file/file1.xml file1.xml 545 04/07/2020 11:12:34 /api/rest/v1/files/bacnet/configuration/file/file1.zip file1.zip 0 04/07/2020 11:12:34 ```
